title: Express Talk: Transcribing Thoughts and Feelings in Chinese Landscape Paintings
hero_caption: Qian Shumei. The Xuehong Pavilion in a Scholar’s Garden, 1831. The Orientals Sundry Fund.
short_description: Join Zhiyan Yang, Rhoades Curatorial Intern in the Department of Asian Art, for a 30 minute tour of the new exhibition Transcribing Thoughts and Feelings: Five Hundred Years of Chinese Landscape Paintings, which explores how Chinese painters throughout history have personalized landscape in various unique ways.
description:
Join Zhiyan Yang, Rhoades Curatorial Intern in the Department of Asian Art, for a 30 minute tour of the new exhibition Transcribing Thoughts and Feelings: Five Hundred Years of Chinese Landscape Paintings, which explores how Chinese painters throughout history have personalized landscape in various unique ways. 

Please note that the artwork on this page may not be featured during the gallery talk.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
